bug.author: joeliedtke
bug.summary: Notebook images referencing out of date Fairing
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened:
Create a Kubeflow Notebooks instance from the TF 1.14 CPU image or TF 2.0 CPU image (have not tested with GPU)
Create a Python3 notebook
Run the following commands in the notebook:
from kubeflow import fairing: Result, ModuleNotFoundError import fairing: Result, loaded !pip show fairing: Result, fairing 0.5 is installed in the default notebook image
What did you expect to happen: Current version of Fairing should be installed in the notebook image. Anything else you would like to add: [Miscellaneous information that will assist in solving the issue.] Environment:
Kubeflow version: 0.7.0 kfctl version: (use kfctl version): Kubernetes platform: GKE Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the labels to this issue, with the confidence of 0.80. Please mark this comment with or to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

It looks like the following line needs to be either be updated with each release, or be updated to install Fairing from PyPi.
kubeflow/components/tensorflow-notebook-image/Dockerfile
Line 107 in b813c9a
git+https://github.com/kubeflow/fairing@a9bb9d5cc1c9f1d75efa31198ddbdccfe176b7bf
